intro: Bicuculla occidentalis, commonly known as the western bicucullate, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological studies.
